meanings.definition: To blow over or across something.
meanings.sent1: The wind overblows the leaves in the park.
meanings.sent2: The fan overblows the papers on the desk.
meanings.sent3: The playful breeze overblows the picnic blanket.
meanings.sent4: The storm overblows the fragile umbrella.
meanings.sent5: The hurricane overblows everything in its path.

meanings.definition: To blow too hard or too much.
meanings.sent1: She overblows the balloon until it pops.
meanings.sent2: He overblows the trumpet during the concert.
meanings.sent3: The child overblows the soap bubbles and giggles.
meanings.sent4: The engine overblows smoke from the exhaust.
meanings.sent5: The chef overblows the cake with too much frosting.

meanings.definition: To exaggerate or make something seem more important than it really is.
meanings.sent1: He always overblows his achievements to impress others.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overblow minor issues into major problems.
meanings.sent3: The fisherman overblows the size of the fish he caught.
meanings.sent4: The politician overblows his promises during the campaign.
meanings.sent5: The author overblows the significance of the character's actions.
